intro: Carduus subcoriaceus, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are covered in a rough, sandpapery texture, giving it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
